title: Bug 113047 - No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed. This issue occurs when creating a new data set without an SQL statement and the new data source has no database/table/column information.
OB: No children node listing is displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. This occurs when creating a new data set without an SQL statement and the new data source has no database/table/column information.
EB: The children node listing should be displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. This should occur even when creating a new data set without an SQL statement, as long as the new data source has database/table/column information.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page.
3. Change the data source to a new one that has no database/table/column information.
4. Observe that no children node listing is displayed.
5. Close the data set editor.
6. Reopen the data set editor and repeat the above steps to confirm the issue.
